alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Cobb; North Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 12:31AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cherokee, central Cobb and north central Fulton Counties through 100 AM EST ... At 1231 AM EST, a strong thunderstorm was over Smyrna, or near Marietta, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Marietta, Mountain Park, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Alpharetta, Smyrna, Milton, Woodstock, Holly Springs, Fair Oaks, Mount Bethel, Hickory Flat, Union Hill, White Water Park, Sweat Mountain, Jim R Miller Park, Birmingham, Sandy Plains, Dobbins Air Reserve Base, and Vinings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
